Support of secondary hyperparathyroidism is in subjects with 25(OH)D levels above 75 nmol/liter.
Histone demethylase recruitment is necessary for ligand-dependent induction of transcription by nuclear receptors.
A transient decrease in histone methylation is necessary for ligand-dependent induction of transcription by nuclear receptors.
Homozygous deletion of murine Sbds gene occurs from osterix-expressing mesenchymal stem and progenitor cells (MPCs).
Homozygous deletion of murine Sbds gene prevents oxidative stress.
Human T-lymphotropic virus type-I-associated myelopathy and tropical spastic paraparesis (HAM/TSP) patients produce Immunoglobulin G (IgG) antibodies.
IgG antibodies cross-react with an immunodominant epitope in Tax.
IFIT1 restricts viral replication.
IFIT1 sequesters mis-capped viral RNAs.
IgA plasma cells are specific for transglutaminase 2.
IgA plasma cells accumulate in the duodenal mucosa on commencement of a gluten-free diet.
Immune responses result in the development of inflammatory Th17 cells.
Immune responses result in the development of anti-inflammatory iTregs.
In mice, P. chabaudi parasites can proliferate faster early in infection when inoculated at lower numbers.
P. chabaudi parasites can not proliferate faster early in infection when inoculated at high numbers.
In transgenic mice, green florescent protein is harbored under the control of the Sox2 promoter.
Less than ten percent of the cells with green florescent colocalize with cell proliferation markers.
Incidence rates of cervical cancer have increased.
The increase in cervical cancer incidence is due to nationwide screening programs.
National screening programs are based primarily on cytology.
Cytology is used to detect uterine cervical cancer.
Increased vessel density decreases the efficacy of chemotherapy treatments.
A reduction in fibrosis decreases the efficacy of chemotherapy treatments.
Less than 10% of gabonese children with Schimmelpenning-Feuerstein-Mims syndrome (SFM) had a plasma lactate of more than 5mmol/L.
Schimmelpenning-Feuerstein-Mims syndrome is also known as SFM.
Leukemia associated Rho guanine nucleotide-exchange factor represses RhoA.
RhoA repression is in response to SRC activation.
Low expression of miR7a represses target genes.
MiR7a exerts a biological function in ovaries.
Lupus-prone mice are infected with curliproducing bacteria.
Lupus-prone mice have higher autoantibody titers compared to controls.
Ly49Q directs the organization of neutrophil migration to inflammation sites.
Ly49Q regulates membrane raft functions.
Macropinocytosis contributes to a cell's supply of amino acids.
Macropinocytosis occurs via the intracellular uptake of protein.
Many proteins in human cells can be post-translationally modified at lysine residues.
The modification of proteins at lysine residues is via acetylation.
Mercaptopurine is anabolized into the inactive methylmercaptopurine.
The anabolization of mercaptopurine is done by thiopurine methyltrasnferase (TPMT).
Metastasic colorectal cancer was treated with a single agent fluoropyrimidines.
Fluoropyrimidines resulted in reduced efficacy and lower quality of life in elderly patients.
Oxaliplatin-based chemotherapy was used in elderly patients.
MicroRNA is involved in the regulation of Neural Stem Cell differentiation and proliferation.
MicroRNA is involved in the regulation of dynamic homeostasis.
Modifying the epigenome in the brain affects the normal human aging process.
The modification affects certain genes related to neurogenesis.
Mutations in G-Beta protein GNB2 are present in many cancers.
Mutations in G-Beta protein GNB2 result in loss of interaction with G-alpha subunits.
Mutations in G-Beta protein GNB2 result in concomitant activation of AKT pathway.
NF2 is also known as Merlin.
NF2 causes phosphorylation and subsequent cytoplasmic sequestration of YAP in Drosophila.
NF2 activates LATS1/2 kinases.
NF2 is also known as Merlin.
NF2 prevents phosphorylation and subsequent cytoplasmic sequestration of YAP in Drosophila.
NOX2-independent pathways can generate peroxynitrite.
Peroxynitrite is generated by reacting with nitrogen intermediates.
Nanoparticles can be targeted against specific cell types.
Aptamers can be incorporated into lipid nanoparticles.
PDPN promotes efficient motility along stromal surfaces.
PDPN activates the C-type lectin receptor.
The activation of the C-type lectin receptor rearranges the actin cytoskeleton in dendritic cells.
PGE 2 promotes intestinal tumor growth.
PGE 2 alters the expression of tumor suppressing genes.
PGE 2 alters the expression of DNA repair genes.
Podocytes are motile.
Podocytes migrate in the presence of injury.
Primary cervical cancer screening with HPV detection has higher longitudinal sensitivity than conventional cytology.
HPV detection can detect cervical intraepithelial neoplasia grade 2.
Pseudogene PTENP1 regulates the expression of PTEN.
PTENP1 functions as an miRNA decoy.
Rapid up-regulation and higher basal expression of interferon-induced genes increase survival of granule cell neurons.
Granule cell neurons are infected by West Nile virus.
Rapid up-regulation and higher basal expression of interferon-induced genes reduce survival of granule cell neurons.
Granule cell neurons are infected by West Nile virus.
Reduced responsiveness to interleukin-2 in regulatory T cells is associated with greater resistance to autoimmune diseases.
Type 1 Diabetes is an example of an autoimmune disease with greater resistance to interleukin-2.
Replacement of histone H2A with H2A.Z slows gene activation in yeasts.
H2A.Z stabilizes +1 nucleosomes.
Sildenafil improves erectile function in men.
Men experience sexual dysfunction as a result of the use of SSRI antidepressants.
Smc5/6 engagment drives the activation of SUMO E3 ligase Mms21.
ATP-dependent remolding drives the activation of Mms21.
Stroke patients with prior use of direct oral anticoagulants have a lower risk of in-hospital mortality.
Stroke patients with prior use of warfarin have a higher risk of in-hospital mortality.
Synaptic activity enhances local release of brain derived neurotrophic factor.
The neurotrophic factor is released from postsynaptic dendrites.
T regulatory cells lack v8.
T regulatory cells lacking v8 are more adept at suppressing pathogenic T-cell responses during active inflammation.
TCR/CD3 microdomains are required to induce the immunologic synapse.
Inducing the immunologic synapse activates T cells.
The DdrB protein is from Deinococcus radiodurans.
Denococcus radiodurans is an alternative SSB.
The US health care system can save up to $750 million.
7% of patients waiting for kidney transplants can participate in the optimized national kidney paired donation program.
The YAP1 and TEAD complex tanslocates into the nucleus.
The YAP1 and TEAD complex interacts with transcription factors and DNA-binding proteins.
The interaction between the YAP1 and TEAD complex and transcription factors and DNA-binding proteins modulates target gene transcription.
The arm density of TatAd complexes is due to structural rearrangements within Class1 TatAd complexes.
The charge zipper mechanism is an example of structural rearrangements within Class1 TatAd complexes.
The benefits of colchicine were achieved with effective widespread use of secondary prevention strategies.
High-dose statins were used as secondary prevention strategies.
The loss of the TET protein functions may have dire biological consequences.
Myeloid cancers may be a consequence of the loss of TET protein functions.
The risk of breast cancer among parous women increases with placental weight of pregnancies.
The association between placental weight and breast cancer risk is strongest for premenopausal breast cancer.
The tip of the inner tube of the toxic type VI secretion system (T6SS) antibacterial effector in Escherichia coli carries toxic effector proteins.
Escherichia coli is a type of bacteria.
The ureABIEFGH gene cluster encodes urease maturation proteins.
The urease maturation proteins encode UreD/UreH, UreE, UreF, and UreG.
Thigh-length graduated compression stockings (GCS) did not reduce deep vein thrombosis in patients admitted to hospital.
Patients admitted to hospital were immobile because of acute stroke.
Tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-) and interleukin-1 (IL-1) are pro-inflammatory cytokines.
TNF- inhibits IL-6.
IL-1 inhibits IL-10.
Ubiquitin ligase UBC13 generates a K63-linked polyubiquitin moiety.
The polyubiquitin moiety is located at PCNA K164.
Up-regulation of the p53 pathway and related molecular events causes cancer resistance.
Up-regulation of the p53 pathway and related molecular events results in a significantly shortened lifespan.
Senescent cells are present in the shortened lifespan.
Accelerated organismal aging is a result of up-regulation of the p53 pathway and related molecular events.
Varenicline monotherapy is more effective after 12 weeks of treatment.
Combination nicotine replacement therapies with varenicline or bupropion are less effective.
aPKCz causes tumour enhancement.
aPKCz affects glutamine metabolism.
mTORC2 regulates intracellular cysteine levels.
xCT inhibition is used to regulate intracellular cysteine levels.
p16INK4A accumulation is linked to an abnormal wound response.
The abnormal wound response is caused by the microinvasive step of advanced Oral Potentially Malignant Lesions (OPMLs).
